query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
1 «Vergine Madre, figlia del tuo figlio, 2 umile e alta più che creatura, 3 termine fisso d’etterno consiglio,
4 tu se’ colei che l’umana natura 5 nobilitasti sì, che ’l suo fattore 6 non disdegnò di farsi sua fattura.
query.result:
1 Virgin Mother, daughter of your son, 2 humble and higher than any creature, 3 fixed term of eternal counsel,
4 you are she who the human nature 5 ennobled so much, that its maker 6 did not disdain to make himself its creation.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
7 Nel ventre tuo si raccese l’amore, 8 per lo cui caldo ne l’etterna pace 9 così è germinato questo fiore.
query.result: 7 In your womb was kindled the love, 8 through whose warmth in the eternal peace 9 thus has this flower germinated.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
10 Qui se’ a noi meridïana face 11 di caritate, e giuso, intra ’ mortali, 12 se’ di speranza fontana vivace.
query.result: 10 Here you are to us midday face 11 of charity, and below, among the mortals, 12 you are of hope a lively fountain.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
13 Donna, se’ tanto grande e tanto vali, 14 che qual vuol grazia e a te non ricorre, 15 sua disïanza vuol volar sanz’ ali.
query.result: 13 Lady, you are so great and so worthy, 14 that whoever wants grace and does not have recourse to you, 15 his desire wants to fly without wings.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
16 La tua benignità non pur soccorre 17 a chi domanda, ma molte fïate 18 liberamente al dimandar precorre.
query.result: 16 Your kindness not only succors 17 to he who asks, but many times 18 freely precedes the asking.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
19 In te misericordia, in te pietate, 20 in te magnificenza, in te s’aduna 21 quantunque in creatura è di bontate.
query.result: 19 In you mercy, in you pity, 20 in you magnificence, in you gathers 21 however much of goodness is in creature.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
22 Or questi, che da l’infima lacuna 23 de l’universo infin qui ha vedute 24 le vite spiritali ad una ad una,
25 supplica a te, per grazia, di virtute 26 tanto, che possa con li occhi levarsi 27 più alto verso l’ultima salute.
query.result:
22 Now this one, who from the lowest hollow 23 of the universe up to here has seen 24 the spiritual lives one by one,
25 supplicates to you, for grace, of virtue 26 so much, that he may with the eyes raise himself 27 higher towards the ultimate salvation.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
28 E io, che mai per mio veder non arsi 29 più ch’i’ fo per lo suo, tutti miei prieghi 30 ti porgo, e priego che non sieno scarsi,
31 perché tu ogne nube li disleghi 32 di sua mortalità co’ prieghi tuoi, 33 sì che ’l sommo piacer li si dispieghi.
query.result:
28 And I, who never for my own seeing burned 29 more than I do for his, all my prayers 30 I offer to you, and pray that they not be few,
31 because you every cloud for him untie 32 of his mortality with your prayers, 33 so that the highest pleasure may unfold to him.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
34 Ancor ti priego, regina, che puoi 35 ciò che tu vuoli, che conservi sani, 36 dopo tanto veder, li affetti suoi.
query.result: 34 Still I pray to you, queen, who can 35 whatever you wish, that you keep safe, 36 after so much seeing, his affections.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
37 Vinca tua guardia i movimenti umani: 38 vedi Beatrice con quanti beati 39 per li miei prieghi ti chiudon le mani!».
query.result: 37 May your guard overcome the human movements: 38 see Beatrice with how many blessed ones 39 for my prayers they close the hands to you!».

40 The eyes from God loved and venerated, 41 fixed on the orator, showed 42 how much the devout prayers are grateful to them;
43 then to the eternal light they straightened, 44 in which one must not believe that is sent 45 by creature the eye so clear.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
46 E io ch’al fine di tutt’ i disii 47 appropinquava, sì com’ io dovea, 48 l’ardor del desiderio in me finii.
query.result: 46 And I who to the end of all desires 47 approached, as I ought to, 48 the ardor of the desire in me finished.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
49 Bernardo m’accennava, e sorridea, 50 perch’ io guardassi suso; ma io era 51 già per me stesso tal qual ei volea:
52 ché la mia vista, venendo sincera, 53 e più e più intrava per lo raggio 54 de l’alta luce che da sé è vera.
query.result:
49 Bernard indicated to me, and smiled, 50 because I should look upwards; but I was 51 already by myself as he wished:
52 because my sight, becoming sincere, 53 and more and more entered through the ray 54 of the high light that from itself is true.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
55 Da quinci innanzi il mio veder fu maggio 56 che ’l parlar mostra, ch’a tal vista cede, 57 e cede la memoria a tanto oltraggio.
query.result: 55 From here onwards my seeing was greater 56 than speech shows, to such a sight it yields, 57 and memory yields to so much excess.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
58 Qual è colüi che sognando vede, 59 che dopo ’l sogno la passione impressa 60 rimane, e l’altro a la mente non riede,
61 cotal son io, ché quasi tutta cessa 62 mia visïone, e ancor mi distilla 63 nel core il dolce che nacque da essa.
query.result:
58 Such is he who dreaming sees, 59 that after the dream the impressed passion 60 remains, and the other does not return to the mind,
61 such am I, because almost all ceases 62 my vision, and still distills to me 63 into the heart the sweetness that was born from it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
64 Così la neve al sol si disigilla; 65 così al vento ne le foglie levi 66 si perdea la sentenza di Sibilla.

Please translate each line literally into English.
67 O somma luce che tanto ti levi 68 da’ concetti mortali, a la mia mente 69 ripresta un poco di quel che parevi,
70 e fa la lingua mia tanto possente, 71 ch’una favilla sol de la tua gloria 72 possa lasciare a la futura gente;
73 ché, per tornare alquanto a mia memoria 74 e per sonare un poco in questi versi, 75 più si conceperà di tua vittoria.

Please translate each line literally into English.
76 Io credo, per l’acume ch’io soffersi 77 del vivo raggio, ch’i’ sarei smarrito, 78 se li occhi miei da lui fossero aversi.
query.result: 76 I believe, for the sharpness that I suffered 77 from the living ray, that I would have been lost, 78 if my eyes were to have had it [the ray].

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
79 E’ mi ricorda ch’io fui più ardito 80 per questo a sostener, tanto ch’i’ giunsi 81 l’aspetto mio col valore infinito.
query.result: 79 And it reminds me that I was more daring 80 because of this to endure, so much that I reached 81 my gaze with the infinite virtue.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
82 Oh abbondante grazia ond’ io presunsi 83 ficcar lo viso per la luce etterna, 84 tanto che la veduta vi consunsi!
85 Nel suo profondo vidi che s’interna, 86 legato con amore in un volume, 87 ciò che per l’universo si squaderna:
88 sustanze e accidenti e lor costume 89 quasi conflati insieme, per tal modo 90 che ciò ch’i’ dico è un semplice lume.
query.result:
82 Oh abundant grace on which I presumed 83 to fix my gaze through the eternal light, 84 so much that the sight was consumed in it!
85 In its depth I saw that is contained within, 86 bound with love in a single volume, 87 that which unfolds throughout the universe:
88 substances and accidents and their habit 89 almost fused together, in such a way 90 that what I say is a simple light.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
91 La forma universal di questo nodo 92 credo ch’i’ vidi, perché più di largo, 93 dicendo questo, mi sento ch’i’ godo.
query.result: 91 The universal form of this knot 92 I believe that I saw, because more broadly, 93 saying this, I feel that I rejoice.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
94 Un punto solo m’è maggior letargo 95 che venticinque secoli a la ’mpresa 96 che fé Nettuno ammirar l’ombra d’Argo.
query.result: 94 One point only is to me a greater lethargy 95 than twenty-five centuries to the undertaking 96 that made Neptune admire the shadow of Argus.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
97 Così la mente mia, tutta sospesa, 98 mirava fissa, immobile e attenta, 99 e sempre di mirar faceasi accesa.
query.result: 97 Thus my mind, all suspended, 98 gazed fixed, immobile and attentive, 99 and ever was made more inflamed by gazing.

100 To that light one becomes so, 101 that to turn from it for another aspect 102 is impossible that it ever consents;
103 because the good, which is the object of the will, 104 is all received in it, and outside of that 105 is deficient that which is there perfect.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
106 Omai sarà più corta mia favella, 107 pur a quel ch’io ricordo, che d’un fante 108 che bagni ancor la lingua a la mammella.
query.result: 106 Now my speech will be shorter, 107 except for what I remember, than that of a child 108 who still wets the tongue at the breast.

109 Not because more than a simple appearance 110 was in the living light that I was looking at, 111 that such is always what was before;
112 but because of the sight that strengthened itself 113 in me looking, a single appearance, 114 changing, it troubled me.

115 In the deep and clear subsistence 116 of the high light appeared to me three circles 117 of three colors and of one appearance;
118 and the one from the other as iris from iris 119 seemed reflected, and the third seemed fire 120 that from here and from there equally breathes out.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
121 Oh quanto è corto il dire e come fioco 122 al mio concetto! e questo, a quel ch’i’ vidi, 123 è tanto, che non basta a dicer ‘poco’.
query.result: 121 Oh, how short is speech and how weak 122 to my understanding! And this, to what I saw, 123 is so much that it is not enough to say ‘little’.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
124 O luce etterna che sola in te sidi, 125 sola t’intendi, e da te intelletta 126 e intendente te ami e arridi!
127 Quella circulazion che sì concetta 128 pareva in te come lume reflesso, 129 da li occhi miei alquanto circunspetta,
130 dentro da sé, del suo colore stesso, 131 mi parve pinta de la nostra effige: 132 per che ’l mio viso in lei tutto era messo.
query.result:
124 O eternal light that dwells in you alone, 125 alone you understand, and from you understood 126 and understanding you love and smile!
127 That circulation that so conceives itself 128 seemed in you as reflected light, 129 from my eyes somewhat circumspect,
130 within itself, of its own color, 131 seemed to me painted with our image: 132 for my face was all placed in it.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English.
133 Qual è ’l geomètra che tutto s’affige 134 per misurar lo cerchio, e non ritrova, 135 pensando, quel principio ond’ elli indige,
136 tal era io a quella vista nova: 137 veder voleva come si convenne 138 l’imago al cerchio e come vi s’indova;
139 ma non eran da ciò le proprie penne: 140 se non che la mia mente fu percossa 141 da un fulgore in che sua voglia venne.

Please translate each line literally into English.
142 A l’alta fantasia qui mancò possa; 143 ma già volgeva il mio disio e ’l velle, 144 sì come rota ch’igualmente è mossa,
145 l’amor che move il sole e l’altre stelle.
query.result:
142 To the high fantasy here power failed; 143 but already my desire and will were turning, 144 as a wheel that is equally moved,
145 the love that moves the sun and the other stars.
